str2: From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I instruct, command, (b) I appoint, assign. From pros and tasso; to arrange towards, i.e. enjoin.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of the base of horion and a derivative of tithemi; a limit-placing, i.e. boundary-line.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
